授業方法:
In principle, this class will be face-to-face; however, all class materials, tasks, and explanations will be posted in a Google Classroom dedicated to this class.

The course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom- Presentation and homework assignments
- As a level 3 course, all English tasks expected to be completed at an advanced level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course may look like, but specific contents will not be decided upon until after a needs analysis is done (during first class) to determine the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students. This schedule will change if we do a virtual exchange or COIL with students in another country. ]**

Week 1: Class overview, introductions, ice breakers

In principle, all 14 sessions will be conducted face to face. 
Needs Analysis Survey: 1 hour
第2回: Week 2: What is culture and intercultural communication? Discuss first 280-word journal

For ten weeks, students will need to submit a 280-word journal based on discussion questions related to the topic.
Journal 1: 1-2 hours
第3回: Week 3: A critical cross-cultural comparison of etiquette; discuss second 280-word journal
第4回: Week 4: Nonverbal communication in intercultural encounters; discuss third 280-word journal
第5回: Week 5: The role of media in perpetuating stereotypes, prejudice, and discrimination; discuss fourth 280-word journal
第6回: Week 6: TV programs and how they may change one’s perspective about culture; discuss fifth 280-word journal
第7回: Week 7: DIE – describe, interpret, evaluate selected visual media; discuss sixth 280-word journal
第8回: Week 8: Canada, its people, and its culture. Is it possible to define? Role of media?; discuss seventh 280-word journal
第9回: Week 9: How is Japan depicted in the media: a look at Mr. Sparkle and The Simpsons; discuss eighth 280-word journal
第10回: Week 10: What causes media to go viral across borders?; discuss ninth 280-word journal
第11回: Week 11: The university experience - comparing the lives of Japanese and Canadian students; short practice presentation; discuss ninth 280-word journal
